page.title: 13Derelict Land
page.content: In Delcombe today there are four derelict dwellings. One being a small detatched bungalow still standing but in a very angerous state. The second dwelling, a detched house standing in a field has now completely collapsed leaving only the chimney stack erect. the remaining two are semi-detched cottages too badly decayed to be of any use as homes although the third one is still being lived in though it is only just habitable. All these dwellings were occupied about twenty years ago. It would appear that all these dwellings will eventually be razed to the ground and the land cleared for farming. Rebuilding being out of the question because of to-days prohibitive costs.
